title: Oxfordshire Live: Wednesday 16 November - BBC News
summary: all the news , weather and sport from across the county on tuesday 15 november .
two arrested over oxford bike murder .
commuters in oxfordshire village ask chiltern railways to reconsider timetabling changes .
oxford dictionaries declares `` post-truth '' as 2016 international word of the year .

documents.title: that 's all from us
text: that 's all from the team at bbc oxford for another day .
we 'll be back with you on oxfordshire live from 08:00 tomorrow , make sure you keep in touch with us on facebook , twitter and email .

documents.title: travel latest : delays in witney due to earlier collision
text: travel latest : delays in witney due to earlier collision
author: Al Ryan
BBC Oxford travel presenter

documents.title: road deaths to be commemorated at thame service
text: on sunday families and friends will commemorate the lives of those lost in road accidents at a service organised by thames valley police and hampshire constabulary .

the memorial service will be held at st mary the virgin church in thame at 15:00 and is an opportunity for members of the public to join the emergency services in remembering those who have died on the region 's roads , or in road collisions elsewhere .
police officers , fire and rescue workers and ambulance staff will participate in the service and they will be joined by the thames valley police choir .

it is believed that thames valley police and hampshire constabulary joint roads policing unit is unique in marking the united nations day of remembrance for road traffic victims by organising such a service .

documents.title: witney road closed after crash
text: station lane in witney is currently closed at its junction with ducklington lane after a crash .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: wahaca 'deeply saddened ' by norovirus case
text: earlier we told you about 16-year-old sarah cousins , from wallingford , whose family is suing wahaca after she became ill after eating at one of its restaurants .
in response , wahaca has said it was `` greatly saddened '' by the case .

it added : `` wahaca has been proactively working with the relevant authorities in order to limit the impact on our customers and employees , following the recent outbreak of suspected norovirus in some of our outlets .
`` working with these authorities , we are confident that the issue has been neutralised .
`` our customers and employees are extremely important to us , and we will continue to give this issue our full attention . ''

documents.title: teenagers arrested in cyclist murder probe
text: two teenagers are arrested on sus of murder after a cyclist is attacked in central oxford .

documents.title: money raised for beaten pensioner
text: money raised for beaten pensioner

documents.title: fuel allowance could benefit wider community
text: better-off pensioners are being urged to give up their winter fuel allowance to help people in need .
author: Henley Standard

documents.title: penguin keeper too beardy by half
text: a beardy penguin keeper at cotswold wildlife park has had half of his facial fuzz shaved off for charity .
after three years of beardiness chris green underwent a shave at the hands of a professional barber alongside his beloved penguin pool .
he has vowed to keep his half beard for two weeks and has so far has raised more than £ 1,000 for make-a-wish .
he 's offered to auction off the shaved half of his beard for charity , but so far there has been no interest .
perhaps people have too many hairs and graces .

documents.title: breakingcyclist murder investigation : two arrested
text: two people have been arrested in connection with a murder in oxford .
eamonn anderson , 56 , suffered head injuries when he was kicked off his bike by a group of six young men in high street in october .
he died nearly three weeks later .
a thames valley police spokesman said : `` an 18-year-old man and a 17-year-old boy from oxford were arrested this morning ( 16/11 ) on sus of murder .
they are in police custody . ''

documents.title: football matches tonight
text: oxford city host peterborough in the second round proper of the fa youth cup at marsh lane in a 19:00 kick off .
in the southern league tonight north leigh make the trip to winchester in division one south & west .
author: Ross Heaton
BBC Oxford Sport

documents.title: 'bed closures ' to save £ 119 on oxfordshire 's hospitals
text: health executives are proposing a consultation on bed closures in the majority of hospitals across oxfordshire .

oxford university hospitals nhs foundation trust - which runs oxford 's churchill and john radcliffe hospitals , the nuffield orthopaedic centre and the horton general hospital in banbury - will run a £ 119m deficit by 2020 if `` efficiency savings '' are not made .
executives are advising that £ 7.9m of investments in gp services will contribute to reducing the number of people attend hospital .
it is not yet known where the bed closures will take place , although the horton general hospital has been earmarked for a `` transformation '' in the care it provides .
author: Alex Regan
South Online

documents.title: your moon over summer fields
text: summer fields school in oxford tells us it was `` too cloudy to see the supermoon on sunday but it 's looking fantastic over summer fields this morning '' .
we have to agree - we 're over the moon with these
if you have a photo you 'd like to share be sure to email it to us .

documents.title: oxfordshire filmmaker on star wars documentary
text: oxfordshire director jon spira has been speaking to bbc arts about his new documentary elstree 1976 .
the film looks behind the scenes of the original star wars film , focusing on the stories of the extras and bit players , often concealed beneath helmets or monster masks .
`` the whole point of elstree 1976 was to examine how something so huge in pop culture affects the people with the smallest tangible link to it , '' he says .
the film is being shown in oxford on 30 november at the ultimate picture palace in oxford , followed by a q & a with cast and crew .

documents.title: breaking'service change at horton hospital ' in bid to save £ 479m across local nhs
text: a leaked document describing plans to save £ 479 million across local nhs services says that service changes at the horton general hospital in banbury are likely .
the banbury hospital , part of oxford university hospitals nhs foundation trust , saw its maternity unit downgraded due to a shortfall in doctors in october .
the document also says the reductions in acute bed-based care will be required across oxfordshire , with more care being offered at gp surgeries .
the document , leaked by reading borough council , sets out a five-year cost saving plan across the health services in oxfordshire , west berkshire and buckinghamshire
author: Alex Regan
South Online

documents.title: 'we must leave earth , ' stephen hawking tells oxford union
text: stephen hawking told an audience in oxford that humanity must continue exploring space to reach 'beyond our humble planet ' .
author: Oxford Mail

documents.title: oxfordshire family sue wahaca over norovirus outbreak
text: the family of a 16-year-old girl , who was hospitalised after eating at a restaurant wahaca , is suing the restaurant chain .
wallingford resident sarah cousins ate at the white city concession of the mexican restaurant on 29 october , and then fell ill .
public health england closed a number of the restaurants , including the white city branch , after more than 300 reports of norovirus from customers .
the 16-year-old 's father mike said : `` the illness sarah suffered was extremely concerning as she ended up being admitted to hospital and we were very worried for her health . ''

documents.title: oxford dictionaries word of the year : what else was shortlisted ?
text: curious about what else was on the oxford dictionaries international word of the year shortlist ?
the words were selected to reflect the social , cultural , political , economic , and technological trends and events of the year .
the list included :

documents.title: 'post-truth ' declared word of the year by oxford dictionaries
text: oxford dictionaries has declared `` post-truth '' as its 2016 international word of the year , reflecting what it called a `` highly-charged '' political 12 months .
it is defined as an adjective relating to circumstances in which objective facts are less influential in shaping public opinion than emotional appeals .
its selection follows june 's brexit vote and the us presidential election .
oxford dictionaries ' casper grathwohl said post-truth could become `` one of the defining words of our time '' .

documents.title: travel update : slow traffic in henley
text: there 's slow traffic on the a4130 white hill inbound in henley-on-thames at the a321 wargrave road junction .
it 's also affecting the a321 wargrave road before a4130 white hill .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: brackley hope for repeat victory over gillingham
text: non-league brackley town have the opportunity to repeat the most famous result in their history tonight as they host gillingham in a fa cup first-round replay .

the match at st james 's park is a repeat of the replay against the kent side three years ago which saw the saints cause a major upset when glenn walker scored the only goal of the game to secure their progression .

brackley put in an impressive display to hold the league one side to a 2-2 draw in the original game earlier this month and boss kevin wilkin says their hopes of knocking out their opponents - who are three divisions above them - rest on being able to match the level of that performance .
our form at home is n't as good as it is away from home , but if we play like that we 'll have every chance of achieving something .
radio oxford has full match commentary on the game tonight from 19:00 .
author: Ross Heaton
BBC Oxford Sport

documents.title: travel update : delays on s5 service
text: service update : a34 s/bound traffic heavy from bicester .
delays up to 20 minutes on the s5 service .

documents.title: islip timetable changes 'incredibly frustrating '
text: dr peter collins , who chairs islip parish council , has been speaking to us about the timetable changes by chiltern railways that will force commuters from his village to drive to oxford parkway .

he said : `` it 's incredibly frustrating , particularly as we 've just had a lot of upheaval while they develop the station and the line through the village within a year they 've cancelled the service the people were using .
`` one would hope that they 'd look at the timetable , look at the service and look at the number of people using it and decide that maybe they can make an adjustment to help us out .
`` i do n't think we 're asking for an awful lot but we are asking for some reconsideration in the light of the plight of the commuters . ''

documents.title: concerns over longer train journeys
text: commuters in an oxfordshire village are asking chiltern railways to reconsider timetabling changes which 'll lengthen their journeys .
people in islip are unhappy some services will no longer be stopping at their station en route to london .
some say they 'll be forced to travel by car to oxford parkway to start their commute as a result .
chiltern railways told us it `` recognises the situation is not ideal and plans to offer season-ticket-holding islip residents free parking at oxford parkway '' .
author: Sophie Law
BBC Radio Oxford news

documents.title: weather : 'bright morning followed by showers '
text: the low cloud is lifting and breaking up and it will brighten up quite nicely over the next few hours and we should see more sunshine than we saw yesterday .
in the afternoon it 'll turn rather breezy and we 'll see some heavy showers feeding in as well so it 'll feel cooler .
highs of 14c ( 57f ) .
author: Bee Tucker
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning
text: good morning and welcome to bbc local live for oxfordshire on wednesday .
thanks to merrill jacobs for our main today - it 's of a beautiful sunset at thrupp lake near abingdon .
as always you can get in touch with us on twitter , facebook and email .
